treatment.description: Perennials, 50–100 cm. Leaves opposite (proximal) or alternate (distal); petioles 1–8 mm; blades ovate to deltate-ovate or lance-olate (distal), 2–10 × 1.3–7 cm, margins serrate or serrulate, faces strigose. Heads borne singly or 2–9 in ± corymbiform arrays. Peduncles 1–15 cm. Involucres 11–15 × 7–15 mm. Phyllary apices gradually narrowed. Paleae 8–11 mm, apices acuminate, shortly cuspidate. Ray florets 6–8; tubes 1.5–2 mm, laminae 9–19 mm. Disc florets 40+; corollas 5.5–6.6 mm (staminal filaments glabrous). Cypselae 5–6.5 mm, ± strigose; pappi of 2 lacerate, aristate scales 5–5.5 mm plus 2–4 lacerate scales 0.5–1.3 mm. 2n = 34.
treatment.habitat: mostly pine forests and limestone soils
